subject: Java Tools for Extreme Programming [was: Re: [junit] Re: ANN: "Unit	Testing in Java" available]
msgSnippet: ... I concur with the other Chip s comments... I thought the book was geared to beginners.  It seemed to me to not be anything more than glorified
messageBody:
On Wed, 2003-06-04 at 17:13, Curt wrote:
> Great. I had B&N order one last night so I could look it over. Is
> there a table of contents available for it somewhere? I checked a
> handful of sites and the description was a little vague. Just
> wondering how in-depth it covers JUnit and if it touches on Ant,
> Cactus, JUnitPref, HttpUnit, etc.
>
> Has anyone read "Java Tools for Extreme Programming: Mastering Open
> Source Tools, including Ant, JUnit, and Cactus"? If so, any
> opinions? I read through it briefly and it seemed like a good intro
> book.

I concur with the other Chip's comments... I thought the book was geared
to beginners. It seemed to me to not be anything more than glorified
documentation for the different tools, which you can easily get on the
web.

=jason
